info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 27 at 2:02PM MST until September 27 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona, including the following county, Yuma and southeast California, including the following county, Imperial.
* WHEN...Until 400 PM MST /400 PM PDT/.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 202 PM MST /202 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Senator Wash, Colorado River and Mission Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Yuma and Southeastern Imperial Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST /4 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
